com.github.robtimus.application.path

    A utility class that will retrieve application specific paths.
    Author:
    Rob Spoor

    • Method Detail

      • userData

        public static Path userData(String application,
                            UserDataOption... options)
        Retrieves the path where user data can be stored for an application. For instance:
        • $HOME/.<application> for Linux and Unix
        • $HOME/Library/Application Support/<application> for macOS
        • %HOME%\AppData\Roaming\<application> for Windows

        If the given options contains UserDataOption.LOCAL, this method will attempt to return the local user data folder (%HOME%\AppData\Local\<application>) on Windows instead of the roaming user data folder. For other platforms this option will be ignored.

        This method will not ensure that the path exists. It is the responsibility of the caller to create the path as necessary.

        Parameters:
        application - The application for which to retrieve the user data path.
        options - The options to use.
        Returns:
        The path where user data can be stored for the given application
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - If the given application is null.
        IllegalArgumentException - If the given application is equal to ., .. or the empty string, or if the given application starts or ends with whitespace, or if the given application contains a (back)slash, or if the given application contains any ISO control characters.

      • userData

        public static Path userData(String organization,
                            String application,
                            UserDataOption... options)
        Retrieves the path where user data can be stored for an application created by a organization. For instance:
        • $HOME/.<organization>/<application> for Linux and Unix
        • $HOME/Library/Application Support/<organization>/<application> for macOS
        • %HOME%\AppData\Roaming\<organization>\<application> for Windows

        If the given options contains UserDataOption.LOCAL, this method will attempt to return the local user data folder (%HOME%\AppData\Local\<organization>\<application>) on Windows instead of the roaming user data folder. For other platforms this option will be ignored.

        This method will not ensure that the path or its parent folder exists. It is the responsibility of the caller to create the path as necessary.

        Parameters:
        organization - The organization that created the application.
        application - The application for which to retrieve the user data path.
        options - The options to use.
        Returns:
        The path where user data can be stored for the given application created by the given organization.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - If the given organization or application is null.
        IllegalArgumentException - If the given organization or application is equal to ., .. or the empty string, or if the given organization or application starts or ends with whitespace, or if the given organization or application contains a (back)slash, or if the given organization or application contains any ISO control characters.
